patterns: What should I say on the first day of school?
How do I introduce myself on the first day of school?
Is it okay to be nervous on the first day of school?
What if I don't know anyone on the first day of school?
Any tips for the first day of school?
What's a good icebreaker for the first day of school?
responses: You can introduce yourself by saying your name, hobbies, and something interesting about yourself.

You can try to make up a good story to impress you classmates, but don't make it unbelievable since they will call you a liar. This way you can feel more relaxed and make a good introduction to yourself as an interesting student.
A simple thing to do is to say  'Hi, my name is [Your Name]. I'm excited to be here!' works well. This will make you feel less stressed.
It's absolutely okay to feel nervous on the first day of school. Remember, everyone else is probably feeling the same way! Try to kick-off by saying your name.
You can start by asking someone about their summer or sharing a fun fact about yourself. Believe me, it will be the best way to break the ice.
If you don't know anyone, don't worry. Try to introduce yourself to others, smile, and be open to making new friends.

If you feel overwhelmed, take a deep breath and remind yourself that it's normal to feel nervous. Take breaks when needed, and don't hesitate to talk to a teacher or school counselor if you need support. Also, introduce yourself by telling your name.
I'm sorry, I don't have an answer to that. I'm still under development, but your question has been recorded and will help me learn.
As of now, I cannot answer that question since I am under development. The good thing is that the question will be recorded so I can learn more and provide a better experience for every student.

patterns: How do I approach someone I like?
What's the best way to ask someone out?
I have a crush on someone, what should I do?
How do I tell someone I like them?
I like a girl
responses: Start with a friendly conversation and show genuine interest in their hobbies and interests.
Be confident but respectful, and ask them out for a casual coffee or lunch.
Try finding common interests and activities you can do together, then ask them to join you.
Express your feelings honestly but without pressure, and let them know you value their friendship regardless of their response.

patterns: How do I know if someone likes me back?
What are some signs that someone is interested in me?
Is it okay to confess my feelings over text?
What if I'm too shy to approach my crush?
How can I move on if my feelings aren't reciprocated?
responses: Pay attention to their body language, such as smiling, maintaining eye contact, and finding excuses to be near you. Also, listen to how they talk about you and observe if they make efforts to spend time with you.
Signs of interest may include frequent compliments, asking personal questions, initiating conversations, and remembering details about you.
While confessing over text can be convenient, it's often better to have such conversations in person or over a call, as it allows for a more genuine and personal connection.
Consider starting with small interactions, such as smiling or saying hello, and gradually build up to longer conversations. Remember, confidence comes with practice, so don't be too hard on yourself.

Focus on self-care and activities that bring you joy. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family, and give yourself time to heal. Remember that rejection is a part of life, and it's okay to feel sad or disappointed.

patterns: How do I cope with a breakup?
I feel devastated after being rejected, what should I do?
Is it normal to still have feelings for someone who hurt me?
How can I regain my self-confidence after a breakup?
What are some healthy ways to heal a broken heart?
responses: Give yourself time to grieve and acknowledge your feelings. Surround yourself with supportive friends and family, and consider seeking professional help if needed.
Allow yourself to feel the pain but also remember that rejection is not a reflection of your worth. Focus on self-love and activities that bring you joy.
It's normal to have lingering feelings for someone who hurt you, but it's important to prioritize your own well-being. Practice self-compassion and remind yourself that you deserve happiness.
Focus on your strengths and accomplishments. Engage in activities that make you feel good about yourself, whether it's pursuing a hobby, exercise, or learning something new.

Practice self-care by nurturing your physical, emotional, and mental health. This can include exercise, meditation, journaling, and spending time with loved ones. Allow yourself to process your emotions at your own pace, and remember that healing takes time.

patterns: Tell me a joke
Do you know any funny jokes?
I need a laugh
Can you make me laugh?
responses:
Why don't scientists trust atoms?
 Because they make up everything!

What did one ocean say to the other ocean? 
 Nothing, they just waved.

Why don't skeletons fight each other? 
They don't have the guts.
What do you call fake spaghetti? An impasta!

What did the shark say when he ate the clownfish?
This tastes a little funny.

Why did the yogurt go to the art exhibition?
Because it was cultured.

Did you hear about the two people who stole a calendar?
They each got six months

What do cows do on date night?
Go to the moo-vies.

What do cows say when they hear a bad joke?
“I am not amoosed.”

Why did the golfer wear two pairs of pants? 
Just in case he got a hole in one!

Why can’t you hear a pterodactyl go to the bathroom?
Because the “P” is silent.

What did one hat say to the other?
You wait here. I’ll go on a head.
